result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Marjorie E Ponce-Prado

records.addlTxt: COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT. Court takes no action as to bail.

Defendant Marjorie E Ponce-Prado not in court.  Attorney Haley E Wentz in court for Marjorie E Ponce-Prado.  Prosecuting attorney Sarah Dahdouh in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Sworn as interpreter: Hilda Shymanik. 
Victims present with Spanish interpreter Hilda Shymanik.
Case in court for Calendar Call.  Defendant failing to appear, Court lifted the stay of the Bench Warrant.  COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT. Court takes no action as to bail.

Defendant Marjorie E Ponce-Prado not in court.  Attorney Haley E Wentz in court for Marjorie E Ponce-Prado.  Prosecuting attorney Sarah Dahdouh in court for the State of Wisconsin. Victims present with Spanish interpreter Sarah Chwaszczewski. Case set for a status conference.  No appearance by the defendant.  Court ordered a bench warrant issued but stayed until the next court date.  Case adjourned to Br. 30.
Calendar call scheduled for September 29, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Marjorie E Ponce-Prado in court with attorney Haley E Wentz.  Sarah Dahdouh appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Marjorie E Ponce-Prado appeared by video means with Attorney.
Case in court for a pre-trial conference. DEFENSE ENTERS A PLEA OF NOT GUILTY. Defense in receipt of discovery and offer and requests time to review case materials.
Case adjourned.  Status conference scheduled for September 16, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
No contact order signed and filed.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with JC

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.

Defendant Marjorie E Ponce-Prado in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Defendant Marjorie E Ponce-Prado in custody.  James C Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Marjorie E Ponce-Prado appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Richards, Branch 30.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defense holds plea.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 9, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
